Hotel is nice, Restaurant is DREADFUL!!
reviews.text: Large rooms, nice terrace, good service. Hotel has nice Mercedes cabs available to move one around the city.

The fine dining restaurant was one of the Worst dining experiences of a lifetime! Very high prices but food was not good, not prepared well and very small portions. Martini, plain, nothing special, $20. Waiter was quite overbearing, described in detail the three butters and the three salts. Seems they are the reason for high price as nothing else was above sub standard. Stayed at the hotel for four days, never saw more than one or two tables occupied. Be wise, avoid this restaurant. Try Scoop by the riverfront, good all around.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are times when our expectations are exceeded. The recent visit by my wife and I to the New York Palace hotel in Budapest was one of those occasions. From the moment that the taxi arrived at the front door, when the concierge came out and opened the door for my wife, our experience in the hotel was exceptional. The reception area is discreet, different to the “norm”, the staff very polite and helpful. The foyer is a work of art and a delight to see, the rooms are beautifully appointed. The breakfast was the best I have experienced in a hotel. If ever you get the opportunity to visit Budapest I suggest you stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Exceptional Hotel

reviews.text: an absolute delight to stay at the new york palace….however…..location is a tab away from the river…..besides that nothing else to complain about…..very high quality and well maintained property
reviews.title: very luxurious indeed

reviews.text: This hotel is absolutely gorgeous. You walk in and you feel you are in some sort of a palace. there is a great mixture of old elegance and modern convienience. Staff was very nice and helpfu. Rooms were huge with big beds and very cool bathroom. the decor was very unique and sophisticated. This hotel definitely has some character. Breakfast was delicious and there was a most amazing spa within the hotel. Expensive but worth it! I highly recommend it!
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel!

reviews.title: Great hotel in the heart of Budapest

reviews.text: Stayed here for my birthday from 7th to 12th July. From the minute we arrived i fell in love with this hotel. The hotel itself is stunning beautifully designed and very luxurious and the room was very spacious with everything you could want (apart from tea and coffee making facilities. The spa was great after a hards days wlaking round the city but i have to compliment the hotel on its staff. Everyone was excellent helful and nothing was too much trouble. From arrival to departure i could not fault in any way. Have stayed in hundreds of hotels around the world and this has to be in my top 5. Well done i will be back.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: Have no doubt, this is one of the worlds most stunning 5 star hotels, it's a feast for the eye, wonderful old building and faithfull restoration. Like stepping back in time.. It is because of this your expectations are high from the moment you arrive and the hotel let's itself down on the basics. We got an unexplained wake up call at 6am, twice staff let themselves in whilst we were in bed, the restaurant has a mixture of simply excellent staff & incompetent boobs who forget your order or just don't come back? The wifi is so so and only works in some locations, the minibar is extortion as is the wine list. So it's not perfect but I'd happily stay here again, it makes visiting Budapest special..
reviews.title: Stunning but let down by small things

reviews.text: We were impressed by the appearance of the hotel. The room was big and beautiful.

aka: Boscolo Budapest, Autograph Collection Hotel Budapest
description: Budapest 5 star luxury hotel Boscolo is located on Grand Boulevard, in the Budapest city center. Perfect for business travel or a relaxing weekend in Budapest, with the most luxurious and spacious rooms among 5 star hotels in Budapest. All Budapest attractions are within easy reach on foot (Budapest Opera House, Szechenyi Bath, Andrassy Boulevard) or with underground and tram just meters from the hotel (Buda Castle, Danube River, Budapest Parliament). The Neoclassical Palace, built in 19th century feature compelling Italian furniture and fabrics, highest quality of marbles, Murano chandeliers and silk wallpaper. The hotel's heart is the world famous New York Cafe with its wonderful frescoes and gilded stucco columns. The Salon fine dining restaurant offers a fantastic gourmet experience while the elegant Bar provides refreshing drinks and live piano music. After a day and enjoying the Budapest weather (we hope!), there's no better place to relax than the unique Boscolo Spa with wide selection of treatments.
